comments.body: Please don't change existing tests that are correct, rather add new tests to cover as much of the new definitions as possible.

from my understanding, even though it's passing, I don't think that this test is correct: tableLayouts should be an object containing user-defined layouts, providing a pre-defined layout is pointless. 

Here is the [related doc](https://pdfmake.github.io/docs/document-definition-object/tables/)

what do you think ?
Oh you're right. I didn't notice this was in BufferOptions. Good catch

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@    fontLayoutCache: true,
    bufferPages: true,
    tableLayouts: customTableLayouts,
    autoPrint: true,
    progressCallback: progress =>
